title: 1979년 Fischer, Spuhl, Herzwurm & Associates, Inc. v. Forrest T. Jones & Co. 사건
summary: 미국 Missouri, MO 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Fischer, Spuhl, Herzwurm & Associates, Inc. v. Forrest T. Jones & Co.. 판결일: 1979-09-11. 법원: Supreme Court of Missouri.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: FISCHER, SPUHL, HERZWURM & ASSOCIATES, INC., Et Al., Appellants, v. FORREST T. JONES & COMPANY, Et Al., Respondents
**판결일**: 1979-09-11
**법원**: Supreme Court of Missouri
**관할**: Missouri, MO

**판사**: Bardgett, Donnelly, Finch, Higgins, Morgan, Rendlen, Seiler, Welborn, Welliver

## 변호인

Harvey M. Tettlebaum, Jefferson City, Theodore S. Schechter, Schechter & Zer-man, Clayton, for appellants., Cullen Coil, Carson, Monaco, Coil & Riley, Jefferson City, John T. Martin, William G. Zimmerman, Robert E. Northrip, Shook, Hardy & Bacon, Kansas City, Forrest T. Jones & Co., Inc., David A. Yarger, Woolsey & Yarger, Versailles, Alex Bartlett, Hen-dren & Andrae, Jefferson City, American Health & Life Ins., Veryl L. Riddle, John J. Hennelly, Jr., Lee H. Wagman, St. Louis, Robert J. Quigley,

## 인용

- 586 S.W.2d 310

## 판결문 요약


586 S.W.2d 310 (1979)
FISCHER, SPUHL, HERZWURM & ASSOCIATES, INC., et al., Appellants,
v.
FORREST T. JONES & COMPANY, et al., Respondents.
No. 60720.
Supreme Court of Missouri, En Banc.
September 11, 1979.
Rehearings Denied October 10, 1979.
*311 Harvey M. Tettlebaum, Jefferson City, Theodore S. Schechter, Schechter & Zerman, Clayton, for appellants.
Cullen Coil, Carson, Monaco, Coil & Riley, Jefferson City, John T. Martin, William G. Zimmerman, Robert E. Northrip, Shook, Hardy & Bacon, Kansas City, Forrest T. Jones & Co., Inc., David A. Yarger, Woolsey & Yarger, Versailles, Alex Bartlett, Hendren & Andrae, Jefferson City, American Health & Life Ins., Veryl L. Riddle, John J. Hennelly, Jr., Lee H. Wagman, St. Louis, Robert J. Quigley, Eldon, New York Life & Health Ins., for respondents.
John D. Ashcroft, Atty. Gen., Roger Bern, Nanette K. Laughrey, Asst. Attys. Gen., Jefferson City, for amicus curiae.
SEILER, Judge.
This is an appeal in a suit wherein plaintiffs sought damages for lost commissions in the sale of insurance allegedly caused by defendants' acts in restraint of trade, claimed to be unlawful under both the former and new Missouri antitrust statutes, and for tortious interference with plaintiffs' business relations. The trial court held that the former antitrust law did not apply to the types of insurance involved in this case, that all activities of the insurance industry are exempt from the Missouri antitrust law of 1974 u...
